item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, December 25, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. T * sin (t)' ≈ Ornamented Christmas Tree (2013) (198 points | 15 comments)
2. This open problem taught me what topology is [video] (31 points | discuss)
3. Bit Vectors and my first steps into assembly (12 points | discuss)
4. Merry Christmas Everyone (446 points | 146 comments)
5. Ruby 3.4.0 (95 points | 24 comments)
6. Show HN: FixBrowser – a lightweight web browser created from scratch (81 points | 17 comments)
7. Trying out QvQ – Qwen's new visual reasoning model (162 points | 51 comments)
8. CRT Simulation in a GPU Shader, Looks Better Than Black Frame Insertion (71 points | 13 comments)
9. Exploring LoRA – Part 1: The Idea Behind Parameter Efficient Fine-Tuning (64 points | 3 comments)
10. Spectral Imaging Made Easy: A Powerful Python Library (18 points | 9 comments)
11. macOS menu bar app that shows how full the ISS urine tank is in real time (722 points | 155 comments)
12. Masks, Smoke, and Mirrors: The story of EgyptAir flight 804 (160 points | 71 comments)
13. A pilot raced through the airport to surprise the woman who saved his life (60 points | 3 comments)
14. Adversarial policies beat superhuman Go AIs (2023) (271 points | 116 comments)
15. News for Ruby 3.4.0 (23 points | 1 comment)
16. Shockley Semiconductor Laboratory (82 points | 27 comments)
17. The number pi has an evil twin (483 points | 189 comments)
18. Are Immutable Linux Distros right for you? (58 points | 40 comments)
19. Camera Ignores Perspective and Sees Behind Walls (13 points | 8 comments)
20. What happened to the world's largest tube TV? [video] (639 points | 277 comments)
21. Earth's subsurface may hold up to 5.6 × 10⁶ million metric tons of hydrogen (30 points | 29 comments)
22. Hoarder: Self-hostable bookmark-everything app (325 points | 62 comments)
23. Jujutsu Megamerges and jj Absorb (40 points | 10 comments)
24. What would it take to add refinement types to Rust? (106 points | 58 comments)
25. Will that hub or dock slow your SSDs, or even make them faster? (64 points | 48 comments)
26. Gordon Mah Ung has died (110 points | 17 comments)
27. On the nature of computing science (1984) (224 points | 90 comments)
28. A Taping of 'Curb Your Enthusiasm' Saved an Innocent Man from Death Row (2017) (58 points | 48 comments)
29. A Practitioner's Guide to Wide Events (58 points | 29 comments)
30. Minutes of a Meeting Held at Gear Ratio on Tuesday 13 June 78 [pdf] (26 points | 7 comments)
